text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) reports the average stock price of 30 large, publicly traded US companies. It tends to reflectdeflectrefluxdeflectingreflectthe state of the stock market as a whole. Though its name would lidleanleadlendleadyou to believe the DJIA is made up of only inducedindustryindustriousindustrialindustrialcompanies, the DJIA, in fact , contains stocks across many “industries,” not all of which are industrial. The business representingrepresentedrepresentrepressedrepresentedinclude finance, food, technology, retail, heavy equipment, oil, chemical, pharmaceutical, consumer goods, and entertainment.
